component.name: Storage Wiper
component.summary: Securely wipe storage devices with DoD-compliant algorithms

description.p: Storage Wiper is a secure disk wiping tool with a modern GTK4/libadwaita interface. It provides multiple DoD-compliant algorithms for permanent data destruction on storage devices.

ul.li: 8 secure wipe algorithms including DoD 5220.22-M, Gutmann, and GOST
Support for HDDs, SSDs, NVMe, and USB drives
ATA Secure Erase for SSDs with hardware support
Real-time progress tracking with pass-level details
Automatic SSD detection with algorithm recommendations
Privilege separation via D-Bus and Polkit for security

description.p: This is a defensive security tool for proper data sanitization when decommissioning storage devices, preparing drives for resale, or ensuring data privacy.

screenshot.caption: Main window showing available disks and wipe algorithms
Wipe operation in progress with real-time status

ul.li: Significantly faster disk list loading with parallel SMART queries
Optimized mount table parsing (single pass instead of multiple)
Added result caching with 500ms TTL for rapid UI updates
Reduced startup time for systems with many disks
New command-line interface (storage-wiper-cli) for scripted wiping
SMART health status indicator (Good/Warning/Critical)
Post-wipe verification support for zero-fill, random-fill, and DoD algorithms
JSON output mode for CLI disk listing
Arch Linux packaging with install hooks
AppStream metainfo for software centers
Systemd service file with security hardening
Estimated time remaining (ETA) display during wipe
Desktop notifications on wipe completion
Write speed display in progress view
Expanded test coverage for all algorithms
Centralized wipe eligibility checks
Added validation for wipe algorithms
Common utility write_with_retry for reliable I/O
Updated project structure documentation
8 secure wipe algorithms
GTK4/libadwaita modern interface
D-Bus privilege separation with Polkit
Support for HDDs, SSDs, NVMe, and USB devices
